alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 11:38PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Big Horn and southern Rosebud Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1134 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms from near Lame Deer to southeast of Forsyth, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall along with winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause ponding on roadways or minor street flooding and fill ditches and culverts. Locations impacted include... Colstrip, Lame Deer, Muddy Cluster and Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavu rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Big Horn; Northern Rosebud; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud
